name: Plumbum aceticum
details: Painful cramps in paralyzed limbs; severe pain and muscular cramps in gastric ulcer; locally, as an application non-homeopathic in moist eczema, and to dry up secretions from mucous surfaces. Care must be used, as sufficient lead can be absorbed to produce lead poison, one to two drams of the LIQUOR PLUMBI SUBACETATIS to the ounce of water; also in pruritus pudendi, equal parts of the LIQUOR PLUMBI AND GLYCERIN.
